metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15126 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in fs/userfaultfd.c in the Linux kernel before 4.13.6. The issue is related to the handling of fork failure when dealing with event messages. Failure to fork correctly can lead to a situation where a fork event will be removed from an already freed list of events with userfaultfd_ctx_put().

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15126` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
linux-signed-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-signed-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2').
linux-signed-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
